title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
description:
When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.

Steps To Reproduce: 
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Note that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu, select the "Shut Down" command to shut down/reboot the computer. 

OB: When shutting down the computer, there is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s), and the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately. 

EB: When shutting down the computer with a dirty model open, users should be presented with a warning or question message box asking if they want to save their changes before proceeding with the shutdown/reboot. 

SR:  
The steps above describe the exact steps to reproduce the issue. It should be noted that the issue occurs when shutting down the computer while a dirty model is open in the WSWB session, without any prompt to save the changes made to the model.
